intro: Dodecatheon puberulentum, commonly known as the pubescent globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name, and it often grows in moist, woodland habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Dodecatheon puberulentum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
